paper_metadata.title: Indonesian poverty alleviation programs after the Asian financial crisis

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: an unconditional cash transfer program (Bantuan Langsung Tunai, or BLT) | The unconditional cash transfer is intended to be used only during crises

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: The difficulty of resolving the problem of poverty immediately after the Asian financial crisis of 1997-98 gave rise to thoughts about the necessity for a stronger focus on results
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: In 2005, with analysis showing that blanket subsidies were mainly benefiting the non-poor, the Indonesian government took the tough political decision to reduce fuel subsidies

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: an unconditional cash transfer program (Bantuan Langsung Tunai, or BLT)
evidence_citations.country_citation: the Indonesian government took the tough political decision to reduce fuel subsidies
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: To protect poor households from the impact of these price increases
